result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th or 6th) and Operating w/ PAC (7th, 8th or 9th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (7th, 8th or 9th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Johnny Mann was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: On driver's license and any vehicle titled in his name commencing upon issuance of valid DL.

miscConds.notes: To be paid within the first 6 months of probation.
The defendant may not consume or possess alcohol and no entry into any taverns or bars.

The defendant must submit a DNA sample.

The defendany must take all medications as precribed and only in the manner in which they are prescribed.

The defendant must continue taking Vivatrol shots as required.

The defendant must undergo an AODA assessment and follow thru with all recommendations.

The defendant must attend at least one AA meeting per week.

The defendant must continue with his current alcohol recommendations.

timeConds.notes:
Huber and good time allowed - eligible for community service under 973.03(3).
Concurrent with: Jail time on 15CF58

records.addlTxt: Defendant Johnny Mann in court with attorney Jeffery Joy.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 1:38 PM. Also called 15CF58. State - all matters resolved - 15CF46 - informs Court of research done by both counsel regarding prior OWI convictions of the defendant - moves to amend count #1 to OWI 6th, plead g/nc to amended count #1, dismiss and read in remaining counts and withhold sentence, place on probation for 3 years, with conditions of: 1 year in FC jail, minimum fines; 15CF58 - moves to amend only count to misd BJ contrary 946.49(1)(a) - reads new penalties - plead g/nc to amended count, joint recommendation of 30 days in FC jail - concurrent to jail time on 15CF46. Mann and Joy agree. Court amends count #1 on 15CF58 to OWI 6th and does so contrary to good cause of 967.055. Mann pleads G to count #1 as amended. Court dismissses and reads in counts #2, #3 and #4. Court amends count #1 on 15CF58 to misd bail jumping contrary to 946.49(1)(a). Mann pleads G to amended count #1. Court has plea questionnaire, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his constitutional rights by entering his plea and right to JT, accepts pleas, adjudges guilty, proceed to sentencing. Mann acknowledges 5 prior OWI convictions. State - follow joint recommendation. Joy makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation. Mann withholds comment. Court has reviewed the file and filings - sentences the defendant to the following: 15CF46 - count #1 - withhold sentence and place on probation for 3 years with conditions of: 1 year in FC jail - huber and good time allowed and eligible for community service under 973.03(3) - report today; AODA and follow thru, no consumption or possession of alcohol and not to enter any bars or taverns, continue with current alcohol recommendation and continue taking vivitrol shots as required, attend at least on AA meeting per week, take medications only as prescribed, fine of $6000 inclusive of costs and assessments - take bond posted - remainder due within the first 6 months of probation, 3 years DL revocation, IID on DL and any vehicles titled in his name commencing upon issuance of valid DL for 3 years, submit DNA sample - form given in court; count #1 on 15CF58 - 30 days in FC jail - concurrent to jail time on 15CF46, costs - take bond from 15CF46 first and then apply remainder to 15CF46 fine, no voting rights, no possession of firearms, right to appeal, adjourned at 2:06 PM.
No consumption of alcohol. Not to enter any bar or tavern. No operation of a motor vehicle.

Defendant Johnny Mann in court with attorney Jeffery Joy.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 1:41 PM. State - here for waiver of PH. Joy and Mann agrees. Court has waiver of PH form, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his right to PH, finds probable cause, binds over for trial. State has filed Information that mirrors the complaint. Mann has Information, waives reading of it, will proceed to ARGN and enters NG pleas to all counts. Court accepts pleas, continues bond, set for FPT.  Final pre-trial scheduled for May 13, 2015 at 02:00 pm. Joy - bond - asks for reduction in bond ($3500 cash)for stated reasons. State - bond - no objections. Court - bond - amends bond to $3500 cash with same conditions, refund $1500 to poster.

Defendant Johnny Mann not in court.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 9:09 AM. State - asks for forfeiture of any bond posted, bench warrant, body or $6000.00. Court so orders. Recalled at 10:23 AM. Johnny Man appears in person and with Jeff Joy who appears telephonically. Joy explains why Mann and himself were not here this AM - Mann thought his date was 5/8/15. Court questions defendant. Defendant states he misplaced the date. Defendant provided with complaint in Court. Joy knows the nature of the complaint and has discussed it with the defendant. Court reads charges and penalties. Mann understand charges and penalties. Court will quash the warrant, vacates bond forfeiture and reinstates the $5000 cash bond. Joy waives further reading and requests PH but will waive the time limits for it and will probably waive the PH as well. Court considers time limits waived, sets for PH on 4/9/15 at 1:00 PM. State informs Court that Jodie Bednar-Clemens will now be the prosecutor.
in Support of Search Warrant - Forced Blood Draw
No consumption of alcohol. Not to enter any bar or tavern. No operation of a motor vehicle.
